title._content: Hypolytrum longifolium subsp. rubescens ( Huber ex C.B.Clarke ) T.Koyama

description._content: Local number: SIA2012-3892 Summary: SIA Acc. 12-045, Box 1, Folder 2; From opposing page: "H. Am. No. 15083; Nome bot.: Hypolytrum rubescens Himlh; Lugar: 'Fabrica' Rio Moju'; Terrenos que prefere: Matta 2r degran, Pes isolados, raros". This photograph is included in the field notes of André Goeldi and part of a collection that includes 36 black-and-white photographs of specimens. André Goeldi was a Brazilian botanist who collected in Pará, Brazil, circa 1913-1920. Identification of image changed from "Hypolytrum rubescens Himlh [sic]" to "Hypolytrum longifolium subsp. rubescens ( Huber ex C.B.Clarke ) T.Koyama" on June 25, 2012. Repository: Smithsonian Institution Archives View more collections from the Smithsonian Institution.
